name: kurento-media-server
description: Media Server responsible for media transmission, processing, loading and recording
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/Kurento/kurento-media-server/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: https://doc-kurento.readthedocs.io/en/stable/
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Al the code pushed to master is a interim version with appropriate comments and public available nightly versions to test.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification: https://doc-kurento.readthedocs.io/en/stable/dev/release.html here you can find how the versioning works and how it must be interpreted.
release_notes_justification: Non-trivial release notes file in repository: <https://github.com/Kurento/kurento-media-server/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md>. Change log is also available in the project main page https://doc-kurento.readthedocs.io/en/latest/project/relnotes/index.html
release_notes_vulns_justification:
We will use the security label in the bugtracker in combination with the rest of the badges to mark the criticalness. And then in the release notes the id of the github issue will be used. 
Within the Release Notes we have a section "Fixed" where all the bugs fixed are listed -with its reference to the github issue id (if any) is provided- 
We don't have an specific way of register or link them with known CVE. That is because all the security bugs found and solved have been bugs on third party libraries, for example a bug on the libnice library that is reported to have a security bug, and we will update this third party library in the next release,  with the latest version that solves this issue. Kurento could be probably added to the low-level software.
report_process_justification: We have both mailing list https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/kurento and issue trackerhttps://github.com/Kurento/bugtracker
report_responses_justification: Met on best effort the project is maintained by a small group but is big and heavily used and we try to acknowledge all the issues reported and provide workarrounds or evaluate the criticalness.
enhancement_responses_justification: Met on best effort the project is maintained by a small group but is big and heavily used and we try to acknowledge all the enhancement request .
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: There is an specific label on the GitHub. We don't have an specific way of reporting but the usual one, the community has used the bugtracker or the mailing list effectively and the issues have always being addressed. https://github.com/Kurento/bugtracker/issues
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: No private reports are requested or supported by default.
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: We give our first response to all the issues reported as soon as possible being always under 7 days from reporting. This is no a vulnerability exactly but is an enhanced related to security and you can assess that we are actively listening the community regarding this. https://github.com/Kurento/bugtracker/issues/518 yo may take also  any other issue of the last 6 months.
test_justification: We have a Jenkins CI in place with some jobs that run the available jobs found in the repositories. https://doc-kurento.readthedocs.io/en/stable/dev/ci.html
test_invocation_justification: https://doc-kurento.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dev/testing.html here there is a whole explanation of what are the provided test and how execute them.
test_most_justification: Kurento not only provides a big set of unitary tests but provides functional tests over demo projects to address the validation of each release and validate it is working. Kurento doesn't maintain different code branches, doesn't have user interaction (no input fields).
test_policy_justification: Unitary tests are always developed for new functionalities, unless they are irrelevant. The CI/CV server executes all test before any release and the tests are public for al the contributors and users to use.
tests_are_added_justification: The tests are public and main functionality is quite stable. Major changes that affect tests provoke the tests to be changed or they will fail and the release could not happen.  Just if the SW has been released it means it has been tested.
tests_documented_added_justification:
In the "Instructions for change requests" the template of PR ask twice for the tests (https://github.com/Kurento/.github/blob/master/pull_request_template.md):
1. In a free text field where it should be explained how it has been tested
2. Checkbox indicating if new tests have been written. 
We usually evaluate those conditions as compulsory requirement.
warnings_justification: Kurento Releases are built firstly as .deb packages to be instaled in Debian/Ubuntu systems. The system tools which generate this files are also the ones activating all security mechanisms when compiling sources: (i) all warnings as errors, (2) memory safety ASLR and many other following the usual recomendations of binary compilings.
warnings_fixed_justification: As treating all WARNING as ERRORS at compilation time if the WARNING isn't addressed there wouldn't be a new release.
delivery_mitm_justification: We delegate the secutirty to our standard distribution mechanisms. Deb repositories verify all the packages with a unique GPG for each project this way even HTTP downloads can be granted as secured. On the other hand we deliver the software as Docker images publicly hosted on DockerHub and we relay on the download security mechanism DockerHub may implement.
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: We prioritize vulnerabilities and crashes over any other issue or request for changes.
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: We prioritize vulnerabilities and crashes over any other issue or request for changes.
static_analysis_often_justification: We execute them manually when we see fit.
dynamic_analysis_justification: Valgrind & AddressSanitizer, but we don't have them integrated in the release cycle we use them when we see fit.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: Valgrind y AddressSanitizer. But as our memory leaks or similar problems usually occur under scenarios very difficult to reproduce. Thus we offer a custom Docker image with AddressSanitizer to users. Then in the case any user finds memory leaks the execution of this image in their specific use case will provide us (and all the community) with the results and can help us to solve the issue.
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: We do but we deactivate all asserts for final builds each release because third party assertions -specifically libnice- were more than a 20% of reported crashes, However they are enabled for debug sessions and code analysis.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: Any error including exploitable vulnerabilities detected are always addressed before launching a release and if detected after the release will be solved and released as a patch in case of critical vulnerabilities or added to the next release for not critical vulnerabilities. .
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: We have a Jenkins CI in place that compiles, test and submit the compiled and dockerized software to the standard repositories.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
english_justification: In http://www.kurento.org/ you may find all the documentation in English about everything from general information, technical and dev, how to interact with the community, how to contribute, how to report bugs, etc
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification: https://doc-kurento.readthedocs.io/en/6.14.0/user/installation.html (Docker, on AWS and Ubuntu packages and from source code instructions are provided)
documentation_architecture_justification: https://doc-kurento.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user/about.html?highlight=architecture  and https://doc-kurento.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user/features.html An architecture diagram should be in place within the documentation in the following months
documentation_current_justification: We have the documentation in read the docs and provide an new version with each release fully revised. It is true that some parts may need some work to be done to be fully detailed but the information provided in the documentation is revised on each version release. There is always the risk of punctual mistakes or errors.
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: This is no GUI nor web based project is a media server. On the other hand probably tutorials may be improved.
internationalization_justification: The software is always behind an application that should be the one in charge of this internationalisation.
sites_password_security_justification: The project doesn't store any password for user in the website or repository or download URL
installation_development_quick_justifica: https://doc-kurento.readthedocs.io/en/6.14.0/dev/dev_guide.html there is a whole guide on how to install run and test the sofware

report_responses_justification: Yes. This is a requirement for membership of the FIWARE Foundation Catalogue.
enhancement_responses_justification: The project has been responding to most enhancement requests.

build_justification: The software is written using Python and its implementation runs directly on the source code.

build_floss_tools_justification: The software is written using Python and its implementation runs directly on the source code.

test_most_justification: Met. Currently coverage of the codebase is well over 69%.
test_policy_justification:
Yes. The CONTRIBUTING file at https://github.com/orchestracities/ngsi-timeseries-api/blob/master/docs/manuals/user/contributing.md says: 

"For all the new functionalities provide tests (see setup_dev_env.sh and run.sh in the root to understand how tests can be run locally)
When done, verify that all tests are passing
If so, create a pull request against our repository (we cannot review pull requests with failing tests)"

Also, the README shows the test coverage, which encourages adding tests as new functionality is added.
tests_are_added_justification: Tests are added as new functionality is added.

warnings_fixed_justification: In general warnings are addressed. In some cases warnings are disabled for specific cases.
warnings_strict_justification: The settings for the warning tools are generally fairly strict.
know_secure_design_justification: https://github.com/chicco785 assumes overall responsibility for this along with the development team.
know_common_errors_justification: https://github.com/chicco785 assumes overall responsibility for this along with the development team.
crypto_published_justification:
This application is a microservice which delegates security to other components such as Keycloak or Keyrock. These security components use bcrypt to store
salted hashed iterated passwords, and https+standard crypto protocols to communicate with users.
The software uses https+standard crypto protocols to communicate with users.
crypto_call_justification: This application is a microservice which delegates security to other components for cryptography and uses https+standard crypto protocols to communicate with users.
crypto_floss_justification: This application is a microservice which delegates security to other components for cryptography and uses https+standard crypto protocols to communicate with users.
crypto_keylength_justification: This application is a microservice which delegates security to other components for cryptography such as Keycloak or Keyrock which provide appropriate key lengths as well as the ability to disable small keys.
crypto_working_justification: This application is a microservice which delegates security to other components such as Keyrock. Keyrock uses bcrypt, which is not broken.
crypto_pfs_justification: This application is a microservice which delegates security to other components such as Keyrock which provide that functionality.
crypto_password_storage_justification: This application is a microservice which delegates security to other components such as Keyrock which provide that functionality.
crypto_random_justification: This application is a microservice which delegates security to other components such as Keyrock which use cryptographically secure random number generators.
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: No such vulnerabilities at this time.
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: No such vulnerabilities at this time.
static_analysis_justification: The project leverages pep8 that controls that python code styling and formatting.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: GitHub identifies vulnerabilities of libraries used and introduces fixes to update libraries. Accordingly we evaluate the merge of the automatically generated PRs.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: The software is written in Python.
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: Instead of embedding run-time assertions, there are many external tests with assertions that are checked during automated testing.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: No issues were found by dynamic analysis.
crypto_weaknesses_justification: This application is a microservice which delegates security to other components such as Keyrock. Keyrock uses bcrypt, which is not broken.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: Code is frequently integrated back into GitHub; Travis and several other tools are then run on the result to determine if there's a problem. If a problem is found, the tools provide feedback via GitHub. For more information, see the BadgeApp's status on Travis.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
no_leaked_credentials_justification: No credentials are stored in public repositories.
english_justification: All documentation is in English, and the project accepts bug reports and comments in English.

CPS exposes restful apis to be used by other services and does not own a GUI. All services are required to authenticate themselves while using the CPS apis. 
CPS includes security fixes in the software lifecycle.

In case of docker container. We can delete the container we don't want. Also control the orchestration in Kubernetes if you want to exclude certain docker images.
dco_justification: ONAP requires both a Developer Certificate of Origin (DCO), and a Contributor License Agreement (CLA). https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Contribution+Agreements

documentation_security_justification: A security sub-committee is driving all components release requirements, best practices. Agreed recommendations become integral parts of an ONAP release and are assessed during milestones. URL : https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/ONAP+Security+coordination

Our contribution and development process details how to quickly contribute to software
https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=93000029

We have weekly meetings to update the current documentation with any changes that are made to the software/
https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=92996419
https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Configuration+Persistence+Service+Project
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: Our application does not have a UI.
internationalization_justification: the software doesn't generate text intended for end-users and doesn't sort human-readable text.
sites_password_security_justification: The project does not store password in the website, repository or downloads.
maintenance_or_update_justification: All major releases are tagged in gerrit and the artifacts are stored with the release information on onap.nexus
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: This wiki explains how to report a vulnerability anonymously https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=93000029
coding_standards_enforced_justification: Configuration Persistence Service uses ONAP checkstyle using the Maven maven-checkstyle-plugin.
build_standard_variables_justification: Our project is written primarily in Java and does not create native binary applications.
build_preserve_debug_justification: The application does not create native binaries.
build_non_recursive_justification: The application does not create native binaries.
build_repeatable_justification: All releases are tagged in gerrit(git), and the builds are controlled using jenkins. By providing the git tag information the same image can be build over and over again with same bit-for-bit result.
installation_standard_variables_justific: The compiled docker images and jar files can be installed/used as the user sees fit. Both run on JVM or docker. So there is no reason to select locations etc.
installation_development_quick_justifica: The project requires only java and maven for a developer to quickly install and test it.
external_dependencies_justification: External dependencies are controlled using the pom file, which can be found in the root folder for the projects. We store most of our common dependencies in the project's parent pom.xml: https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=cps.git;a=blob;f=cps-parent/pom.xml;h=643d2cc63f0f7fadf1569d93b45f1562fe26b265;hb=HEAD
updateable_reused_components_justificati: We do this using our dependency pom https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=cps.git;a=blob;f=cps-dependencies/pom.xml;h=237dd7ca957aeb43d929afcfe53a6e1f12c52e63;hb=refs/heads/master
interfaces_current_justification: We avoid using deprecated and obsolete functions.
automated_integration_testing_justificat: Tests are run before merging code. The code cannot be merged without a +1 from jenkins.
regression_tests_added50_justification: When regressions occur, we add tests for them.
test_policy_mandated_justification: Contributing guide lines for development is recorded in https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies
implement_secure_design_justification: in case of exception for the REST APIs, the request is denied.
input_validation_justification: The project strives to validate all input to functions. We validate data against the appropriate yang models.
signed_releases_justification: We have not had a release yet.
version_tags_signed_justification: All release artifacts are cryptographically signed by the Linux Foundation prior to release.

require_2FA_justification:
Before a user can push to change to the repo, it has to be reviewed from multiple contributors and committers. Only a committer can merge a code to central repository.
This ensures 2 factor authentication, though not through SMS.
secure_2FA_justification:
Before a user can push to change to the repo, it has to be reviewed from multiple contributors and committers. Only a committer can merge a code to central repository.
This ensures 2 factor authentication, though not through SMS.
code_review_standards_justification:
The Onap specifications for code review is used in CPS . It is ensured that there are atleast 2 +1s from unassociated significant contributors and committers before the code is merged.
•	https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Committer+Best+Practices#CommitterBestPractices-BestPractices
two_person_review_justification:
The Onap specifications for code review is used in CPS . It is ensured that there are atleast 2 +1s  from unassociated significant contributors and committers other that the person who has raised the review before the code is merged.
•	https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Committer+Best+Practices#CommitterBestPractices-BestPractices
test_statement_coverage90_justification:
CSIT Integration test suite is included to test all the REST apis that are developed in CPS . Example :
•	https://github.com/onap/cps/tree/master/csit
The coverage check is tested reported using Jacoco coverage in the sonar 
•	https://sonarcloud.io/component_measures?id=onap_cps&metric=coverage&view=list
•	https://sonarcloud.io/component_measures?id=onap_cps-cps-temporal&metric=coverage&view=list
test_branch_coverage80_justification: Test suites covers the entire code in the branch except for the Unit tests and CSIT Integration tests.
security_review_justification:
ONAP runs nexus IQ report once every release to ensure the security requirements are met
https://jenkins.onap.org/view/cps/job/cps-maven-clm-master/
assurance_case_justification: The project release wikis document all our security vulnerabilities. The release notes in the documentation provides list of fixes done per release. https://docs.onap.org/projects/onap-cps/en/latest/release-notes.html

name: NNStreamer
description: Neural Network (NN) Streamer enables stream processing paradigm for neural network applications by supplying GStreamer plugins for neural network applications.
contribution_justification: Non-trivial contribution file in repository: <https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/blob/main/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The LGPL-2.1 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The LGPL-2.1 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification:
Some documentation basics file contents found.
Wiki: https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/wiki
Documents: https://nnstreamer.github.io/
documentation_interface_justification:
API References: https://nnstreamer.github.io/API-reference.html
Sample Apps: https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer-example
NNStreamer is a set of GStreamer plugins, and users may use GStreamer APIs to access NNStreamer: https://gstreamer.freedesktop.org/documentation/
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs: https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made: https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Every commit should go through automated test & verification and review processes (at least 2 approvals without any rejections from committers): https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/pulls
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification:
Git Commit ID is available.
For "official" release, we add git tags, too.
version_tags_justification: Each release is combined with a git tag, which is combined with a git commit: https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/releases
release_notes_justification: https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/blob/main/CHANGES is the release note in code.
release_notes_vulns_justification: We have no publicly known vulnerabilities (not received any CVE reports, yet)
enhancement_responses_justification:
https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues?q=feature

Unresponded enhancement requests are usually maintainer's notes for future feature plans (written by the maintainer).
vulnerability_report_process_justificati:
https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues

We have no distinction between general bug reports and security vulnerability reports.
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: We do not have private report channels.
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: The only vulnerability report was https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/1763 (1 year ago), which was resolved within one day.
build_justification:
Every PR is built and tested automatically: https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/pulls (look inside PR's "All checks have passed" or "Some checks were not successful")
Daily builds are at http://nnsuite.mooo.com/nnstreamer/ci/taos/daily-build/build_result/
test_most_justification:
As of today, LCOV shows that 80.9% of lines and 93.2% of functions are covered by GTEST and SSAT automated tests.
http://nnsuite.mooo.com/nnstreamer/ci/gcov_html/index.html
test_policy_justification: We require any feature to accompany with test cases (GTEST or SSAT). Without it, the maintainer generally does not accept the feature. We also try to keep the test coverage over 80% (lines) at any time.
tests_are_added_justification:
Ubuntu/Debian: https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/blob/main/debian/rules#L55 : It runs automated test suite mandatorily for PPA and Per-PR build.
Tizen/OpenSUSE/Fedora: https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/blob/main/packaging/nnstreamer.spec#L630 : It runs automated test suite (if user/system wants). In daily builds, it is mandatory for all architectures. In Per-PR checks, we check all test cases for x64 architectures and check a few of them for ARM architectures.
warnings_justification:
https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/blob/main/.TAOS-CI/config/config-plugins-prebuild.sh configures static checkers of TAOS-CI.
For every commit and PR, we check, "are Doxygen tags available?", "indentation and coding styles", "clang-format checks", "pylint", "newline at the end of file", "rpm spec statements", "file formats (no binaries!)", "cppcheck", "commit messages", "timestamps", "file attributes", "common misspells", "doxygen grammars", "the size of commits (fails if too big)", "prohibitted keywords", "commit sign-offs", "shell script checks", "flawfinder".

Any single fail from all the static checkers ==> No committers will review them ==> Cannot be merged.
warnings_fixed_justification: We do not allow compiler warnings: https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/blob/main/meson.build#L9
know_secure_design_justification: Project team uses a SDL software development approach https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/securityengineering/sdl/  and works closely with an independent security team in the company during the entire development cycle. https://github.com/jaeyun-jung is the security contact of the project.
know_common_errors_justification: Probably, the maintainer and top committers are.
delivery_unsigned_justification: During the connection, the TLS 1.2 protocol is used which eliminates the use of weak algorithms for authentication.
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: We have been addressing such issues within a few days (no more than a week)
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: We have been addressing such issues within a few days (no more than a week)
static_analysis_justification:
For every commit or PR: cppcheck
For every release: Coverity
static_analysis_fixed_justification: Every stable release should have ZERO issues from all static checkers
static_analysis_often_justification: Cppcheck and all other static checker (not Coverity, though) are done for every PR (pull request).
dynamic_analysis_justification: In-house dynamic code analysis tool (TAOS-CI's "post-build" sessions, Apache 2.0) is used for every release and every pull request.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: With Tizen's infrastructure (build.tizen.org), we do ASAN with every code submit to Tizen (roughly once or twice a week).
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: Hundreds of unit test cases (executed for every pull request) have a lot of assertions.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification:
Any issues found by CI from a pull request (PR) are required to be fixed before merged.
Any issues found by tests from daily or regular checks are usually addressed within a few days because the same code is used for products.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio:
Every PR goes through TAOS-CI ( https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/pulls ), we do daily build.
Launchpad PPA does daily build as well: https://launchpad.net/~nnstreamer/+archive/ubuntu/ppa
Tizen's infra does automated build & tests as well: https://build.tizen.org/package/show/Tizen:Unified/nnstreamer
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
no_leaked_credentials_justification: We do not have any credentials in repositories.
english_justification: Every document, comments, and issues are written in English: https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.
